title: Pokémon Go online battles coming in 2020 via Go Battle League
text:
Pokemon Go…ing online

Ranked matchmaking will arrive in Pokémon Go early next year, allowing for online battle for the first time, but there is a catch…

When Pokémon Go first launched, back in the summer of 2016, you could barely do anything but catch pokémon. Trainer battles were only added late last year, but the game is slowly gaining more and more features and it looks like next year is going to be particularly big.

Despite what you might imagine, Pokémon Go is currently more popular than at any time since it was first released and that’s unlikely to change once online battles are an option.

To that end, developer Niantic has announced Go Battle League, which seems to be exactly what it sounds like. Except the catch is that you will still have to outside and walk if you want to get a match.

When do Pokémon Go online battles start?

The blog announcing Go Battle League is very short, and purposefully vague, but it implies that you’ll have to use Pokémon Go outside a set amount in order to earn entry to the league.

After that you’ll be able to ‘battle opponents from around the globe through an online matching system and rise in the ranks of the league’.

What Niantic are trying to avoid is a situation where players just sit at home battling online, although it remains to be seen exactly how much prior exercise is going to be demanded of you.

The only start date for Go Battle League is ‘early’ 2020, but a new Dev Insights video is promised soon that will go into more detail and hopefully nail down a date.
